p: Among the 829 participants who entered the cohort as dengue-naïve, 555 dengue-naïve participants completed the first annual of follow-up and provided a blood sample. These participants contributed 560.5 person-years of time. Over the first year of follow-up, 74 dengue-naïve participants experienced a primary dengue infection. The overall percent of seroconverting naïve individuals was 13.3%. The incidence rate of primary dengue infections was 132.0 infections per 1,000 person-years (95% CI: 104.4, 164.8). There were twice as many seroconverting naïve individuals in Progreso (14.8%) and Merida (14.2%), as compared to Ticul (7.7%) ( Table 7).
